list_definition.definition: a copy or representation of something usually on a much smaller scale

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a model of the Taj Mahal

list_definition.definition: a particular type or design of something, eg a car, that is manufactured in large numbers

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Our car is this year’s model.

list_definition.definition: a person who wears clothes etc so that possible buyers can see them being worn

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He has a job as a male fashion model.

list_definition.definition: a person who is painted, sculpted, photographed etc by an artist, photographer etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I work as an artist’s model.

list_definition.definition: something that can be used to copy from

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Use the sentences in the coursebook as models for your own writing.

list_definition.definition: a person or thing which is an excellent example

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She is a model of politeness

list_definition.definition: to wear (clothes etc) to show them to possible buyers
to work or pose as a model for an artist, photographer etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She models at the local art school.

list_definition.definition: to make models (of things or people)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He models (the heads of famous people) in clay.
She modelled the clay into the shape of a penguin
